CatDescriptText: Mr. Lester Austin, concrete finisher, of Homewood was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 26, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "In your opinion, what effect on the community do interracial churches have? Do you believe this type of membership should be encouraged?  Why?"  Answer reads: "It would be good in a colored section but not so good in a white area.  The biggest majority of people there would not accept it."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Lester Austin, wearing light colored jacket with collar, light colored sweater, dark cap, and eyeglasses, standing on Liberty Avenue in front of Empire Building with window with hanging wreath
